hero.title: UX/UI Designer
hero.subtitle: based in Paris
hero.description: Specialized in designing intuitive and engaging user interfaces, I transform complex ideas into elegant digital solutions. My approach combines user research, design thinking, and attention to detail to create products that resonate with their users.
project.gouv.description: Adaptation and redesign of the priority policies page for the French government. An ambitious project aimed at improving accessibility and clarity of government information for all citizens.
project.agora.description: Complete application for wholesalers at the Rungis market combining order taking, solvency, electronic invoicing, and accounting. A complex B2B project aimed at digitalizing business processes.
project.gomind.description: Complete redesign of the showcase website for an IT services company specialized in GreenIT. Creation of a modern visual identity, an AI mascot generator, and a design system to improve B2B client acquisition.
project.mastercoach.description: Complete artistic direction for an EdTech platform allowing coaches to sell training and digital products. Creation of the showcase website and video content for a rapidly growing market.
skill.uxresearch.title: UX Research
skill.uxresearch.description: Understanding users to create experiences that meet their real needs
skill.uidesign.title: UI Design
skill.uidesign.description: Creating elegant and intuitive interfaces that delight users
skill.designthinking.title: Design Thinking
skill.designthinking.description: Solving complex problems with creativity and methodology
skill.tools.title: Tools & Tech
skill.tools.description: Mastery of modern design tools and technical skills
skill.video.title: Video Production
skill.video.description: Creating engaging video content from shooting to final editing
skill.frontend.title: Front-End
skill.frontend.description: Web development to bring designs and prototypes to life
contact.title: Let's work together
contact.description: Have a project in mind? Want to discuss an idea? Feel free to contact me, I would be happy to talk with you.

gouvernement.context.challenge: Major challenge: Reconciling regulatory accessibility requirements with a modern and engaging experience, while respecting the constraints of the French State Design System (DSFR).

gouv.title: Gouvernement.fr
gouv.subtitle: As a UX/UI Designer at the Government Information Service (SIG), I contributed to the modernization of info.gouv.fr ‚Äî the digital showcase of the French government ‚Äî by working on improving readability, accessibility, and visual consistency of key pages.
gouv.team.value: Designers, PMs, data analysts, and SIG developers
gouv.context.intro: Info.gouv.fr receives several million monthly visits and is the main entry point for citizens wishing to learn about the government's priority policies. Faced with high bounce rates (>60%) and difficulty accessing information, a redesign was imperative.
gouv.context.objectives.title: Objectives:
gouv.context.obj1: Improve clarity and accessibility of strategic landing pages
gouv.context.obj2: Increase conversion rate on priority CTAs (procedures, appointments)
gouv.context.obj3: Ensure RGAA AA+ compliance and strict DSFR consistency
gouv.context.obj4: Reduce time to access critical information for citizens
gouv.context.obj5: Prepare measurement infrastructure (GA4 tracking, GTM, consent mode)
gouv.context.challenge.label: Major challenge:
gouv.context.challenge.text: Reconciling regulatory accessibility requirements with a modern and engaging experience, while respecting the constraints of the French State Design System (DSFR).
gouv.method.research.title: Research & Audit
gouv.method.research.desc: Complete DSFR audit (components, tokens, contrast), heuristic analysis, benchmarking of European institutional sites, GA4 analysis of risky paths.
gouv.method.workshops.title: Framework workshops
gouv.method.workshops.desc: Multi-party FigJam workshops (business, communication, dev) to define objectives, key messages, objections and RICE/MoSCoW feature prioritization.
gouv.method.architecture.title: Architecture & Wireframes
gouv.method.architecture.desc: Sitemap simplification (reduced navigation depth), annotated mobile-first wireframes with optimized information hierarchy (hero + proof + CTA).
gouv.method.design.title: High-fidelity design
gouv.method.design.desc: DSFR-compliant Figma mockups with proactive proposals for micro-interactions and smooth transitions, validated and retained by the teams.
gouv.method.prototype.title: Prototyping & Testing
gouv.method.prototype.desc: High-fidelity interactive prototypes with user testing scenarios, A/B variants for CTA and hero message optimization.
gouv.method.measure.title: Measurement & Optimization
gouv.method.measure.desc: GTM/GA4 tagging plan, UX KPI definition (CTA click, process completion, scroll depth), performance check (lazy-load, media weight).
gouv.benchmark.title: International UX Benchmark
gouv.benchmark.intro: Comparative analysis of UX best practices on European and North American government sites to identify patterns of excellence and innovation opportunities.
gouv.bench.govuk.title: GOV.UK
gouv.bench.govuk.desc: Excellence in task-oriented navigation and benefit-oriented user messages
gouv.bench.canada.title: Canada.ca
gouv.bench.canada.desc: "How can we help you?" structure optimizing quick access to priority services
gouv.bench.eu.title: European Union
gouv.bench.eu.desc: Clean design with priority search and clear information architecture
gouv.bench.portal.title: Government Portal
gouv.bench.portal.desc: Categorization by business domains with clear iconography and explicit CTAs
gouv.bench.france.title: Gouvernement.fr (before)
gouv.bench.france.desc: Institutional communication approach with focus on political news
gouv.bench.germany.title: Bundesregierung.de
gouv.bench.germany.desc: Complex management of federal structure with content personalization
gouv.bench.insight.label: Key insight:
gouv.bench.insight.text: The best-performing sites (GOV.UK, Canada.ca) favor a "service first" vs "institution first" approach. The emphasis is on what the user can accomplish rather than government communication.
gouv.workshops.title: Collaborative Workshops
gouv.workshops.intro: Multi-stakeholder FigJam workshops to align business objectives, technical constraints, and user expectations. "Design Thinking" approach adapted to institutional context.
gouv.workshops.figjam.title: FigJam Workshop - Priority Policies Redesign
gouv.workshops.figjam.desc: Collaborative session with business, communication, and technical teams to identify UX pain points and co-build solutions. Divergence ‚Üí convergence method with RICE prioritization.
gouv.workshops.s1.title: üîç Session 1 - Diagnosis
gouv.workshops.s1.item2: Mapping of technical and editorial constraints
gouv.workshops.s1.item3: Analysis of business objectives by department
gouv.workshops.s2.title: üí° Session 2 - Ideation
gouv.workshops.s2.item1: UX solutions brainstorming (simplified dashboard, clear CTAs)
gouv.workshops.s3.title: ‚úÖ Session 3 - Decision
gouv.prototype.title: Prototyping & Design System
gouv.prototype.intro: Adaptation of the DSFR (French State Design System) to create specific components for the Priority Policies dashboard. Atomic design approach with complete documentation for development teams.
gouv.prototype.ds.title: Design System - DSFR Adaptation
gouv.prototype.ds.desc: Creation of specialized components (Structure, States, Style, Alternatives) for the Priority Policies dashboard. Complete documentation of tokens, variants, and usage guidelines.
gouv.prototype.structure.title: üß© Structure
gouv.prototype.structure.desc: Definition of component elements with clear hierarchy and consistent spacing according to DSFR tokens.
gouv.prototype.states.title: ‚ö° States
gouv.prototype.states.desc: Complete management of interactive states (default, hover, focus, disabled) with respect for RGAA accessibility constraints.
gouv.prototype.style.title: üé® Style
gouv.prototype.style.desc: Visual variations (horizontal, vertical) with harmonized borders and consistent system typography.
gouv.prototype.alternatives.title: üîÑ Alternatives
gouv.prototype.alternatives.desc: Desktop/mobile variants with display options (desktop view, vertical cards) to optimize multi-device experience.
gouv.prototype.innovation.label: DSFR Innovation:
gouv.prototype.innovation.text: Creation of unprecedented components while strictly respecting government design system constraints. This approach maintained visual consistency while meeting project-specific needs.
gouv.transform.title: UX/UI Transformation: Before / After
gouv.transform.intro: Comparison of user experience before and after the redesign. Focus on improving readability, accessibility, and user engagement through a data-driven approach.
gouv.transform.before.title: Before - Institutional approach
gouv.transform.before.issue1: Complex navigation with too many levels
gouv.transform.after.title: After - User-oriented approach
gouv.transform.metrics.title: Measurable transformation impact
gouv.transform.metric.cta.label: CTA click rate
gouv.transform.metric.time.label: Info access time
gouv.transform.metric.bounce.label: Bounce rate
gouv.transform.metric.access.label: Accessibility score
gouv.process.title: Design Process
gouv.process.step1.title: Audit & Diagnosis
gouv.process.step1.desc: Complete DSFR audit: identification of component gaps, sizes, line heights, focus/hover states, contrast ratios. GA4 path analysis to identify friction points.
gouv.process.step2.title: Framework workshops
gouv.process.step2.desc: FigJam workshops to align business/communication/tech on priority policies (PPG). Critical path mapping and feature prioritization.
gouv.process.step3.title: Wireframing & Architecture
gouv.process.step3.desc: Creation of annotated mobile-first wireframes with optimized information hierarchy. Sitemap simplification to reduce navigation depth.
gouv.process.step4.title: High-fidelity design
gouv.process.step4.desc: DSFR-compliant Figma mockups with proactive micro-interaction proposals. Token adjustments (typography, colors, spacing) and components to ensure AA+ accessibility.
gouv.process.step5.title: Prototyping & Validation
gouv.process.step5.desc: Interactive prototypes with user testing scenarios. A/B variants of hero sections to optimize messages and CTAs. Accessibility testing (NVDA, VoiceOver).
gouv.process.step6.title: Deployment & Measurement
gouv.process.step6.desc: Tracking preparation (GTM, GA4, consent mode v2). Developer documentation and design system. Post-deployment KPI monitoring and continuous optimizations.
gouv.results.title: Results & Measured Impact
gouv.results.cta.label: Primary CTA click rate
gouv.results.cta.desc: Significant conversion improvement through better visual hierarchy and benefit-oriented CTAs.
gouv.results.time.label: Information access time
gouv.results.time.desc: Average time reduction through funnel structure and simplified path.
gouv.results.rgaa.label: RGAA AA+ compliance
gouv.results.rgaa.desc: Complete compliance with accessibility standards (contrast, keyboard navigation, screen readers).
gouv.results.engagement.label: User engagement
gouv.results.engagement.desc: Increased time spent and scroll depth on strategic pages.
gouv.results.bounce.label: Bounce rate
gouv.results.bounce.desc: Significant bounce rate decrease through benefit-oriented hero messages.
gouv.results.debt.label: Design debt
gouv.results.debt.desc: Drastic reduction through DSFR standardization and unified Figma library.
gouv.results.chart1.title: Key performance indicators evolution
gouv.results.chart2.title: Before / after redesign impact
gouv.chart.cta.label: CTA click rate (%)
gouv.chart.engagement.label: User engagement (%)
gouv.deliverables.title: Deliverables & Design System
gouv.deliverables.intro: Beyond screens, I produced a complete set of deliverables to ensure project sustainability and scalability:
gouv.deliverables.wireframes.title: Annotated wireframes
gouv.deliverables.wireframes.desc: Complete series of mobile-first wireframes with detailed annotations on information hierarchy and behaviors.
gouv.deliverables.mockups.title: High-fidelity mockups
gouv.deliverables.mockups.desc: Figma mockups with micro-interactions and smooth transitions. Hero variants (short benefit-oriented title + proof + CTA).
gouv.deliverables.ds.title: DSFR Design System
gouv.deliverables.ds.desc: Unified Figma library (atoms ‚Üí templates) with standardized tokens (typography, spacing, colors) and usage guidelines.
gouv.deliverables.doc.title: Developer documentation
gouv.deliverables.doc.desc: Complete technical documentation with responsive rules, component nomenclature, and integration examples.
gouv.deliverables.audit.title: RGAA audit report
gouv.deliverables.audit.desc: Detailed report of identified gaps and corrections applied to ensure AA+ compliance.
gouv.deliverables.tracking.title: GA4 tagging plan
gouv.deliverables.tracking.desc: Definition of events to track (CTA click, scroll depth, process completion) and UX KPI dashboard.
gouv.deliverables.ds.highlight.label: Design System:
gouv.deliverables.ds.highlight.text: Creation of a complete private Figma library for complex tables (atoms ‚Üí templates) with standardized tokens and component usage guidelines (when/how, do/don't). This rationalization reduced design/integration time by 40% and improved UI consistency across all projects.
gouv.learnings.title: Learnings & Insights
gouv.learnings.item1.label: Accessibility as creative constraint:
gouv.learnings.item1.text: Strict adherence to RGAA AA+ is not a barrier to innovation, but a framework that forces clarity and readability thinking. Contrast and hierarchy constraints led to stronger and more effective design choices.
gouv.learnings.item2.label: The power of benefit-oriented messages:
gouv.learnings.item2.text: Replacing institutional titles with messages focused on concrete benefits for citizens had a direct and measurable impact on engagement (+28%) and conversion (+42%).
gouv.learnings.item3.label: The importance of multi-party framing:
gouv.learnings.item3.text: FigJam workshops with business, communication, and tech teams quickly aligned all stakeholders and avoided costly back-and-forth at the end of the project.
gouv.learnings.item4.label: Measurement as a continuous improvement lever:
gouv.learnings.item4.text: The GA4 tagging plan implemented from design allowed tracking the real impact of design decisions and quickly iterating on areas to optimize.
gouv.learnings.item5.label: Design System as strategic investment:
gouv.learnings.item5.text: DSFR standardization and creation of a unified Figma library reduced design debt by 60% and significantly accelerated future projects.
gouv.learnings.reflection.label: Key reflection:
gouv.learnings.reflection.text: In a public service context, every design decision has a direct impact on access to rights and services for millions of citizens. This responsibility imposes methodological rigor and attention to detail that goes far beyond aesthetics.
gouv.cta.title: Ready to elevate your public services?
gouv.cta.subtitle: I support public and semi-public organizations in turning their digital platforms into inclusive, accessible, impact-driven experiences. Let's talk about your upcoming challenges.
gouv.cta.disclaimer: Reply within 48h ‚Äì Available for embedded support or focused missions.
gouv.toc.title: Table of Contents
agora.title: AgoraSquare
agora.subtitle: Complete application for Rungis market wholesalers combining order taking, solvency, electronic invoicing and accounting.
agora.challenge.context.title: Context
agora.challenge.context.p1: The Rungis market, the world's largest wholesale market, is the lung of French food supply. Yet, despite their strategic position in food distribution, wholesalers still used largely manual processes to manage their daily operations.
agora.challenge.context.p2: Between Excel sheets, paper notebooks and obsolete systems, they wasted precious time in an environment where every minute counts. Orders were placed by phone or on paper, customer solvency verification was approximate, and manual invoicing generated countless errors.
agora.challenge.issues.title: Identified Issues
agora.challenge.issue1.label: Inefficient order management
agora.challenge.issue1.text: Time-consuming manual entry with high error risks
agora.challenge.issue2.label: Lack of solvency visibility
agora.challenge.issue2.text: Recurring unpaid invoices due to lack of financial information
agora.challenge.issue3.label: Complex manual invoicing
agora.challenge.issue3.text: 2 to 3 hours per day dedicated to invoicing
agora.challenge.issue4.label: No data centralization
agora.challenge.issue5.label: Accounting tracking difficulties
agora.challenge.objective.title: Main Objective
agora.challenge.objective.text: Create a complete and intuitive application that digitalizes the entire commercial cycle: from order taking to accounting, through solvency verification and electronic invoicing. The challenge was to design a tool simple enough to be adopted by professionals unfamiliar with digital tools, while being powerful enough to manage complex operations.
agora.challenge.constraints.title: Project Constraints
agora.challenge.constraints.intro: The project had to meet several specific technical and human constraints:
agora.challenge.constraint1: Interface usable from 3am, in variable lighting conditions
agora.challenge.constraint2: Compatibility with tablets and computers for usage flexibility
agora.challenge.constraint3: Offline operation to overcome market connection problems
agora.challenge.constraint4: Integration with existing accounting systems (EBP, Sage, Cegid)
agora.challenge.constraint5: Compliance with French electronic invoicing standards
agora.research.title: Research Phase
agora.research.methodology.title: Methodology
agora.research.methodology.p1: To understand the real needs of wholesalers and design a truly adapted solution, I adopted an immersive approach. I spent several weeks at the Rungis market, observing practices, conducting in-depth interviews and analyzing existing workflows in their natural context.
agora.research.methodology.p2: This field research phase was essential to grasp the nuances of the profession, understand physical constraints (night work, cold environment, goods handling) and identify real friction points in daily processes.
agora.research.personas.title: Main Personas
agora.research.personas.intro: From this research, I identified 3 main personas representing the application's target users:
agora.research.persona.pierre.title: Pierre, 52 years old - Fruit and vegetable wholesaler
Process orders quickly to maximize revenue
agora.research.persona.pierre.frustratio: Wastes time with paperwork, suffers regular unpaid invoices
agora.research.persona.pierre.behavior.t: Not comfortable with digital tools, favors simplicity
agora.research.quote.text: We need a fast and reliable tool. Here, every minute counts and we can't afford to waste time with a complicated system.
agora.research.quote.author: ‚Äî Pierre, fruit and vegetable wholesaler for 25 years
agora.research.journey.title: User Journey Mapping
agora.research.journey.text: I mapped the complete journey of a typical day, from arrival at 3am to accounting closure, identifying key moments, emotions and improvement opportunities at each step.
agora.ideation.title: Ideation & Wireframes
agora.ideation.architecture.title: Information Architecture
agora.ideation.architecture.p1: From research insights, I designed a clear information architecture, structured around 4 main modules responding to identified needs: Orders, Customers & Solvency, Invoicing and Accounting. The goal was to create optimized paths for quick execution under stress and fatigue conditions.
agora.ideation.architecture.p2: Each module was designed to minimize cognitive load and reduce the number of steps needed to accomplish the most frequent tasks. Navigation was simplified to the maximum, with direct access to essential functions from the home screen.
agora.ideation.wireframes.title: Wireframes & Iterations
agora.ideation.wireframes.text: I created several series of wireframes, tested and iterated with users. The first versions were too complex and were progressively simplified following wholesaler feedback. Each screen was optimized to reduce the number of clicks and facilitate quick entry.
agora.ideation.principles.title: Design Principles Adopted
agora.ideation.principle1.label: Execution speed
agora.ideation.principle1.text: Minimize clicks and favor direct actions (maximum 3 clicks for any action)
agora.ideation.principle2.label: Error prevention
agora.ideation.principle2.text: Real-time validation with clear messages and automatic correction suggestions
agora.ideation.principle3.label: Visual clarity
agora.ideation.principle3.text: Strong hierarchy, zones well identified by colors, high contrasts for optimal readability
agora.ideation.principle4.label: Adaptability
agora.ideation.principle4.text: Responsive tablet and desktop design with optimized touch zones (minimum 48px)
agora.ideation.principle5.label: Offline-first
agora.ideation.principle5.text: Operation without stable connection with automatic synchronization upon network return
agora.ideation.principle6.label: Immediate feedback
agora.ideation.principle6.text: Instant visual feedback on each action to reassure the user
agora.ideation.flows.title: Optimized User Flows
agora.ideation.flows.intro: I mapped and optimized the 3 critical application flows:
agora.chart.userflows.title: Average duration of critical paths (in minutes)
agora.chart.userflows.note: Average times measured during user testing (n = 8 wholesalers) on identical scenarios.
agora.chart.userflows.insight1.label: Express order taking
agora.chart.userflows.insight1.text: 12 steps and 5 minutes reduced to 4 steps and 1.5 minutes thanks to auto-completion.
agora.chart.userflows.insight2.label: Solvency verification
agora.chart.userflows.insight2.text: 6 minutes of scattered research brought down to 2 minutes with real-time score.
agora.chart.userflows.insight3.label: Electronic invoicing
agora.chart.userflows.insight3.text: 7 steps and 15 minutes reduced to 3 steps and 3 minutes via automatic generation.
agora.chart.ordertime.title: Prototyping iterations ‚Äî order entry time
agora.chart.ordertime.note: Measurements taken on identical scenarios during successive test sessions.
agora.prototype.title: Prototypes & Final Design
agora.results.title: Results & Impact
agora.learnings.title: Learnings
gomind.title: GoMind
gomind.subtitle: Complete redesign of a GreenIT-specialized ESN's corporate website. Creation of a modern visual identity, an AI mascot generator, and a design system to improve B2B client acquisition.
gomind.hero.img.alt: GoMind website redesign with AI mascot generator
gomind.challenge.intro: GoMind, an ESN specialized in eco-design and GreenIT, had a corporate website that didn't reflect its technical expertise or innovation values. The cluttered design, lack of clear CTAs and confusing user journey limited the acquisition of new B2B clients and didn't encourage candidates to join the adventure.
gomind.challenge.stat1.label: Bounce rate
gomind.challenge.stat2.label: Prospect conversions
gomind.challenge.objective.title: Main Objective
gomind.challenge.objective.text: Create a modern visual identity that inspires confidence, facilitate B2B client acquisition, attract tech talents, and provide the team with an AI-customizable mascot to strengthen their storytelling across all channels.
gomind.research.intro: I started with 2 days on-site to understand the needs identified by the no-code developer and business challenges. Analysis of the existing site, co-creation sessions, and use of AI to structure business insights.
gomind.research.step1.title: Existing UX Audit
gomind.research.step1.text: Critical analysis of current site: friction, cluttered design, invisible CTAs
gomind.research.step2.title: Internal Workshops
gomind.research.step2.text: 2 days on-site with no-code dev to frame needs and constraints
gomind.research.step3.title: AI-Augmented Analysis
gomind.research.step3.text: Using AI to structure business insights and initial proposals
gomind.research.step4.title: Co-creation Workshops
gomind.research.step4.text: Collaborative iterations to refine design and product vision
gomind.research.insights.title: Key Discovered Insights
gomind.research.insight1: Visual identity didn't reflect tech expertise and innovation
gomind.research.insight2: CTAs were almost invisible, sometimes simple text links
gomind.research.insight3: Candidate/client journey was confusing and poorly differentiated
gomind.research.insight4: Cluttered design harmed credibility and conversion
gomind.research.insight5: Need for a flexible mascot to humanize communication
gomind.research.quote.text: We were fed up with our website. It no longer represented us and we were losing business opportunities because of it.
gomind.research.quote.author: ‚Äî Antoine, CEO GoMind
gomind.ideation.intro: Hybrid approach combining generative AI to accelerate ideation and senior expertise for strategic framing. I defined a clear architecture, precisely evaluated deadlines, and delivered 1 day before deadline.
gomind.ideation.principles.title: Adopted Design Principles
gomind.ideation.principle1.label: Clarity above all
gomind.ideation.principle2.label: Optimized conversion
gomind.ideation.principle3.label: Tech modernity
gomind.ideation.principle3.text: Identity reflecting GreenIT expertise and innovation
gomind.ideation.principle4.label: Flexibility
gomind.ideation.principle4.text: Modular design system for WordPress no-code
gomind.ideation.principle5.label: AI-powered storytelling
gomind.ideation.chart.title: Team satisfaction evolution
gomind.comparison.title: üé® Site Transformation
gomind.prototype.intro: Creation of mockups adapted to WordPress no-code constraints, with custom embeddable components. Development of an AI-driven 3D mascot generator with filter system to automate visual production.
gomind.prototype.timeline1.title: Visual Identity
gomind.prototype.timeline1.text: Complete redesign: modern palette, clear typography, flexible 3D mascot
gomind.prototype.timeline2.title: Design System
gomind.prototype.timeline2.text: WordPress-ready modular components, embed code for forms and CTAs
gomind.prototype.timeline3.title: AI Mascot Generator
gomind.prototype.timeline3.text: One-page with filters generating AI prompts to create mascot variants
gomind.prototype.timeline4.title: No-Code Adaptation
gomind.prototype.timeline4.text: Dev collaboration: simplified components, embeddable code, WordPress constraints
gomind.prototype.tests.title: A/B Tests - Key Adjustments
gomind.prototype.tests.intro: Iterations based on workshops and team feedback:
gomind.prototype.test1: Form simplification and improved fixed CTA UX
gomind.prototype.test2: 40% reduction in visual density for increased clarity
gomind.prototype.test3: Added micro-interactions for engagement (hover, scroll reveals)
gomind.mascots.title: üé≠ Mascot & AI Generator
gomind.mascots.standard.title: Standard Version
gomind.mascots.standard.text: Main mascot used on website and social media
gomind.mascots.creative.title: Creative Version
gomind.mascots.business.title: Business Version
gomind.results.intro: The website is currently under development. Expected objectives are based on enthusiastic team feedback and ESN B2B sector benchmarks.
gomind.results.stat1.label: Expected bounce rate
gomind.results.stat2.label: Prospect conversions
gomind.results.stat3.label: Candidate engagement
gomind.results.stat4.label: Team satisfaction
gomind.results.chart.title: Expected post-launch objectives
gomind.results.impact.title: Expected Business Impact
gomind.results.impact.text: The GoMind team is very satisfied with the mockups and eager for deployment. The AI mascot generator should enable 3x production increase of visual content for communication.
gomind.learnings.success.title: What worked well
gomind.learnings.success1: AI as ideation accelerator (not as final solution)
gomind.learnings.success3: Delivery 1 day before deadline thanks to precise scope evaluation
gomind.learnings.improve.title: What I would do differently
gomind.learnings.improve1: Involve developers even earlier in decisions
gomind.learnings.improve2: Plan 2-3 days buffer for technical adjustments
gomind.learnings.improve3: Document design system more from the start
gomind.cta.title: Ready to accelerate your next digital product?
gomind.cta.subtitle: I support product and marketing teams in turning digital experiences into sustainable growth levers. Let's talk about your goals.
gomind.cta.disclaimer: Reply within 48h ‚Äì Open to embedded support or focused missions.
agora.research.chart.note: Volumes presented correspond to activities actually carried out in the field and were used to calibrate the design phase.
agora.research.chart.legend1: 3 weeks of immersion and 15 wholesalers observed
agora.research.insights.title: Key Insights Discovered
agora.research.insights.intro: Observations and interviews revealed specific needs and constraints that guided all design decisions:
agora.research.insight1.label: Intense work rhythm
agora.research.insight1.text: Wholesalers work from 3am in difficult conditions (cold, fatigue)
agora.research.insight2.label: Critical speed
agora.research.insight2.text: Entry speed is crucial to avoid losses of perishable goods
agora.research.insight3.label: Financial risk
agora.research.insight3.text: Lack of visibility on solvency generates significant unpaid invoices
agora.research.insight4.label: Administrative burden
agora.research.insight4.text: Manual invoicing takes 2-3h per day minimum, time lost from core business
agora.research.insight5.label: Simplicity required
agora.research.insight5.text: Need for a simple interface, without superfluous features that would slow usage
agora.research.insight6.label: Unstable connectivity
agora.research.insight6.text: Frequent network problems requiring robust offline mode
agora.ideation.flow1.label: Express order taking
agora.ideation.flow1.text: 12 steps and 5 minutes reduced to 4 steps and 1.5 minutes thanks to auto-completion.
agora.ideation.flow2.label: Solvency verification
agora.ideation.flow2.text: 6 minutes of scattered research brought down to 2 minutes with real-time score.
agora.ideation.flow3.label: Electronic invoicing
agora.ideation.flow3.text: 7 steps and 15 minutes reduced to 3 steps and 3 minutes via automatic generation.
agora.prototype.tests.title: Iterative User Testing
agora.prototype.tests.intro: I conducted 6 user testing sessions with 8 different wholesalers, each session bringing its share of insights and adjustments. The iterative process progressively validated each critical feature.
agora.prototype.highfi.title: High-Fidelity Mockups
agora.prototype.highfi.text: Once the wireframes were validated, I created high-fidelity mockups by applying the design system and refining every visual detail. Each screen was designed to work in real usage conditions: low light, glove manipulation, speed of execution.
agora.prototype.designsystem.title: Complete Design System
agora.prototype.designsystem.intro: To ensure consistency and facilitate development, I created a complete design system documenting all components, styles and patterns of the application:
agora.prototype.ds.typo.title: Typography
agora.prototype.ds.typo.text: Sans-serif font with generous sizes (16px minimum for body text, 24px for titles). Strong typographic hierarchy to quickly scan information.
agora.prototype.ds.colors.title: Color Palette
agora.prototype.ds.colors.text: Color system by status for immediate understanding: green (paid/validated), orange (pending/alert), red (problem/refused). High contrasts for optimal readability.
agora.prototype.ds.icons.title: Iconography
agora.prototype.ds.icons.text: Set of 45 custom icons, clear and recognizable even at small size. Minimalist style to avoid any visual confusion.
agora.prototype.ds.components.title: UI Components
agora.prototype.ds.components.text: 15 reusable components (buttons, cards, forms, tables) to ensure consistency and accelerate development.
agora.prototype.ds.grid.title: Grid & Spacing
agora.prototype.ds.grid.text: Flexible grid system with generous spacing (minimum 16px) to avoid click errors and improve readability.
agora.prototype.ds.states.title: States & Interactions
agora.prototype.ds.states.text: Clearly differentiated states (normal, hover, active, disabled) with immediate visual feedback. Subtle animations to guide attention without slowing usage.
agora.prototype.responsive.title: Adaptive Interface
agora.prototype.responsive.intro: The interface was designed to perfectly adapt to the two main usage contexts:
agora.prototype.tablet.title: Tablet Mode (Field)
agora.prototype.tablet.text: Interface optimized for quick tactile entry in the market: wide buttons (minimum 50px), simplified navigation, robust offline mode. Designed to be usable with gloves and in low light conditions.
agora.prototype.desktop.title: Desktop Mode (Office)
agora.prototype.desktop.text: Enriched interface for administrative tasks at the office: detailed dashboards, accounting exports, advanced settings management. Optimized keyboard navigation for productivity.
agora.prototype.poc.title: Decisive Proof of Concepts
agora.prototype.poc.intro: To validate the most critical and risky features, I created functional prototypes testable in real conditions:
agora.prototype.poc1.title: Express offline ordering
agora.prototype.poc1.item1: Delayed synchronization tested at Rungis at 5am with 6 volunteer wholesalers.
agora.prototype.poc1.item2: Perceived latency divided by three thanks to local caching and instant status messages.
agora.prototype.poc1.item3: Simplified tactile interface after two iterations, reducing scanned item errors by 42%.
agora.prototype.poc1.lead: Clickable prototype reproducing order entry from a tablet in degraded mode. The goal: confirm wholesalers can complete an order in under 90 seconds even without network.
agora.prototype.poc2.title: Real-time solvency score
agora.prototype.poc2.item1: API chain + Excel fallback tested with finance team, covering 95% of client portfolio.
agora.prototype.poc2.item2: Color codes and interpretation messages validated in 3 workshops for reading in < 3 seconds.
agora.prototype.poc2.item3: Scoring gateway exposed to CTO to secure technical integration and GDPR compliance.
agora.prototype.poc2.lead: Mini Node backend and UI mockup connected to Experian API to display a reliable score in under 2 seconds. This test reassured stakeholders about the business viability of reducing unpaid invoices.
agora.prototype.interactive.title: Interactive Prototype
agora.prototype.interactive.text: I created a fully interactive Figma prototype reproducing the complete flows of the application. This prototype was used for user testing and stakeholder presentations, validating the experience before development.
agora.prototype.ab.title: A/B Tests - Key Adjustments
agora.prototype.ab.intro: Several A/B tests optimized crucial interface elements:
agora.prototype.ab1.label: Button size
agora.prototype.ab1.text: Increased from 38px to 50px to improve click success rate
agora.prototype.ab2.label: Favorites system
agora.prototype.ab2.text: Added quick access to recurring customers, reducing entry time by 60%
agora.prototype.ab3.label: Invoicing simplification
agora.prototype.ab3.text: Reduced from 7 steps to 3 steps following user feedback
agora.prototype.ab4.label: Smart search
agora.prototype.ab4.text: Implementation of predictive search with typo tolerance
agora.prototype.ab5.label: Visual indicators
agora.prototype.ab5.text: Reinforced visual statuses following interpretation errors
agora.prototype.a11y.title: Accessibility
agora.prototype.a11y.text: Although the application is intended for specific professional use, I ensured compliance with accessibility standards: WCAG AA contrasts, keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, screen reader support for administrative functions.
agora.prototype.figma.title: Interactive Figma prototype
agora.prototype.figma.text: Explore the animated mockup tested with wholesalers and presented to business teams.
agora.results.deployment.title: Deployment & Adoption
agora.results.deployment.p1: Deployment was done progressively with 25 volunteer wholesalers over 6 months. This wave approach allowed continuous adjustment of the application based on field feedback and ensured optimal adoption rate.
agora.results.deployment.p2: A personalized support program was implemented: 2h individual training, dedicated phone support, and weekly visits during the first month. This special attention was decisive in convincing the most reluctant users.
agora.results.kpi.note: Data consolidated over 6 months from the first 25 equipped wholesalers.
agora.results.impact.title: Measurable Business Impact
agora.results.impact.note: Administrative time, error rate and payment delay measured on a panel of 25 equipped wholesalers.
agora.results.impact1.label: Time dedicated to administrative tasks
agora.results.impact1.text: from 3 h/day to 0.8 h/day, over 2 hours recovered each day.
agora.results.impact2.label: Invoicing errors
agora.results.impact2.text: rate reduced from 40% to 6%, nearly ‚Ç¨15,000 saved per year per wholesaler.
agora.results.impact3.label: Average payment delay
agora.results.impact3.text: from 45 to 30 days, immediately improving cash flow.
agora.results.feedback.title: User Feedback
agora.results.quote1: Before, I spent 3 hours a day on paperwork. Now, 45 minutes is enough. I can finally focus on my profession.
agora.results.quote1.author: ‚Äî Pierre, fruit and vegetable wholesaler
agora.results.quote2: The solvency system saved me several times. No more unpleasant surprises with ‚Ç¨10,000 unpaid.
agora.results.quote2.author: ‚Äî Marie, dairy products wholesaler
agora.results.quote3: At first I was skeptical, but now I couldn't do without it. It has become essential.
agora.results.quote3.author: ‚Äî Jean, meat wholesaler
agora.results.longterm.title: Long-term Impact
agora.results.longterm.intro: Beyond immediate metrics, AgoraSquare had a structural impact on wholesalers' activity:
agora.results.longterm1.label: Continuous evolution
agora.results.longterm1.text: New features added every quarter based on user feedback
agora.results.longterm2.label: Geographic expansion
agora.results.longterm2.text: Planned deployment on other wholesale markets in France
agora.results.longterm3.label: Active community
agora.results.longterm3.text: Creation of a mutual aid group among users
agora.results.longterm4.label: Training
agora.learnings.intro: This project taught me a tremendous amount about designing B2B tools for non-tech users in constrained environments. Here are my main learnings:
agora.learnings.success.title: What Worked Well
agora.learnings.success1.label: Extended field immersion
agora.learnings.success1.text: The 3 weeks spent at Rungis were crucial to understand real needs and constraints. No office interview could have revealed these insights.
agora.learnings.success2.label: Iterative approach and frequent testing
agora.learnings.success2.text: Testing quickly and often (every 15 days) with real users avoided many costly mistakes.
agora.learnings.success3.label: Co-creation from the start
agora.learnings.success3.text: Involving wholesalers from the initial design phases created a sense of ownership and facilitated adoption.
agora.learnings.success4.label: Radical simplicity
agora.learnings.success4.text: Resisting the temptation to add "nice but not essential" features paid off. Users appreciated the simplicity.
agora.learnings.success5.label: Adaptive design system
agora.learnings.success5.text: Creating a design system from the start accelerated development and ensured visual consistency.
agora.learnings.challenges.title: Challenges Encountered & Solutions
agora.learnings.challenge1.title: Challenge 1: Resistance to change
agora.learnings.challenge1.text: Many wholesalers were reluctant to abandon their paper notebooks. Solution: Personalized support program, individual training, and transition period with double entry (paper + digital) for 2 weeks.
agora.learnings.challenge2.title: Challenge 2: Offline technical constraints
agora.learnings.challenge2.text: Offline mode was technically complex to implement, especially for data synchronization. Solution: Technical architecture planned from the start with the CTO, functional prototypes to validate feasibility.
agora.learnings.challenge3.title: Challenge 3: Diversity of use cases
agora.learnings.challenge3.text: Each wholesaler had specific needs (fruits, meats, dairy products). Solution: Flexible and customizable modules rather than a single rigid solution.
agora.learnings.improve.title: What I Would Do Differently
agora.learnings.improve1.label: Involve developers earlier
agora.learnings.improve1.text: Some design ideas proved complex to develop. Closer collaboration from wireframes would have avoided back and forth.
agora.learnings.improve2.label: Allow more time for offline mode
agora.learnings.improve2.text: Offline synchronization took 30% extra time. The initial estimate should have been doubled.
agora.learnings.improve3.label: Document decisions more
agora.learnings.improve3.text: Some design decisions made in the research phase were forgotten 6 months later. Continuous documentation would have helped.
agora.learnings.improve4.label: Anticipate product evolution
agora.learnings.improve4.text: Some architectural choices made it difficult to add new features. Thinking "scalability" from the start is crucial.
agora.learnings.improve5.label: Plan training from the beginning
agora.learnings.improve5.text: User training was improvised. A structured program from the design phase would have facilitated adoption.
agora.learnings.skills.title: Skills Developed
agora.learnings.skills.intro: This project allowed me to develop or strengthen several key skills:
agora.learnings.skill1: Conducting user research in complex real conditions
agora.learnings.skill2: Designing for users unfamiliar with digital tools
agora.learnings.skill4: Communicating with various stakeholders (wholesalers, developers, management)
agora.learnings.skill5: Creating complete and documented design systems
agora.learnings.skill6: Measuring impact and ROI of design decisions
agora.learnings.vision.title: Vision for the Future
agora.learnings.vision.intro: Several evolutions are planned to enrich AgoraSquare:
agora.learnings.vision1: Artificial intelligence to predict orders and optimize inventory
agora.learnings.vision2: Integrated marketplace to facilitate wholesaler-restaurateur connections
agora.learnings.vision3: Dedicated mobile app for delivery drivers with route optimization
agora.learnings.vision4: Advanced analytical dashboard for strategic decision support
